grading_system.description: Trinity County publishes food facility inspection reports but specific grading methodology not found in official sources

inspection_details.reinspection_trigger: Reinspection fees charged for subsequent reinspections unless acceptable corrective time schedule submitted and approved
inspection_details.public_disclosure: Trinity County publishes food facility inspections online for public viewing with inspection reports available by facility

fire_safety_authority.department_name: Multiple local volunteer fire departments serve different areas - no central county fire authority identified

regulatory_framework.state_vs_local_authority: County level - Trinity County Environmental Health Division conducts inspections
regulatory_framework.local_ordinances: Must coordinate with Trinity County Planning Division and Building Division for permits

confidence_notes: While Trinity County clearly operates food facility inspections and publishes reports, the specific grading methodology (letter grades, numerical scores, pass/fail) is not detailed in available official sources. Fire department authority structure unclear as county appears to rely on multiple volunteer fire departments rather than single AHJ.
verification_notes: Direct contact with Trinity County Environmental Health Division needed to confirm: 1) Exact grading system methodology, 2) Inspection frequency and risk-based scheduling, 3) Fire safety inspection authority and requirements for commercial kitchens, 4) Specific local ordinances beyond state food code
